result.execSummary:
The defendant Garret M Vandierendonck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant sentenced to a total of 3 years consecutive in WSP; 18 months initial incarceration; 18 months extended supervision imposed and STAYED and defendant placed on PROBATION.  Defendant IS ELIGIBLE  For CIP and WSAP.

superMiscConds.notes: See Condition same as PROBATION without house time.

timeConds.notes: With release privileges for employmenjt and the day reporting center (programming/vocational training. NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING ALLOWED.......*****DECISION & ORDER dated August 27, 2014, Judge William Brash: Defendant GRANTED 'good time' credit while serving this conditional time in HOC*****

records.addlTxt:
Decision and Order Granting Request for Good Time Credit, signed and filed.  

THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the defendant is granted good time credit while serving the conditional jail term of this case.  The clerk's office shall amend the judgment of conviction accordingly and forward a copy of the same to the House of Correction records department.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for good time credit.

Defendant Garret M Vandierendonck in court with attorney Christopher J Ertl.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  WCS report reviewed with the parties.  At the request of WCS, Court instructs the defendant to pay towards program fees.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Christopher J Ertl in court, defendant Garret M Vandierendonck not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the Court for Scheduling conference.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Garret M Vandierendonck in court with attorney Christopher J Ertl.  David Feiss for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 4/30/14.
